snippet.title: Piano keyboard hacked to play Doom
snippet.description: No, it's not the soundtrack. Developer David Hayward and friends have wired up a piano keyboard in place of a QWERTY version to play Doom.

snippet.title: Piano keyboard hacked to play Doom
Leonardo da Vinci piano hybrid heard after 500 years
snippet.description: The viola organista combines keyboard and cello in a unique string sound dreamed up by the Renaissance genius.

snippet.title: Piano Tie plays to the geek crowd
snippet.description: The tie's capable of playing eight notes. That's a whole octave plus an extra, which should let you perform classics like Chopsticks, if not Tchaikovsky.

snippet.title: Old but awesome: The YouTube piano
snippet.description: Ever wanted to turn YouTube into a musical instrument? Now you can, with the YouTube piano: a creative use of YouTube's annotation system.

snippet.title: Piano player bot tickles the ivories in Taiwan
snippet.description: Quirky robots showcased at the Taipei International Robot Show include a 10-fingered keyboard player and a bizarre horse-drawn carriage.

snippet.title: Yamaha reinvents the digital piano
snippet.description: Priced at $20,000 Yamaha's Avant Grand piano might seem expensive for a digital piano, but it's a clone of a $120,000 Yamaha piano.

snippet.title: Composer gives piano a human voice
snippet.description: A computer connected to this piano analyzes human speech with the assistance of a composer and converts it to key-tapping.

snippet.title: Remember the YouTube piano? Meet its sibling
snippet.description: As a follow-up to the YouTube piano project, its creators have introduced a new toy that makes use of YouTube's deep-linked annotations feature: a working radio.

snippet.title: Piano app for iPad proves screen size matters
snippet.description: Take a sneak peek at the Nota app for the Apple iPad, a tool for learning and practicing piano.
